attributes.action: Stop starving the people of Afghanistan
attributes.additional_details:
The World Food Programme describes the situation in Afghanistan as “the worst humanitarian crisis on earth”. At least a million children under five are at risk of dying of malnutrition. 95% of people don’t have enough to eat.

80% of Afghanistan’s budget comes from external aid. Most of this was suspended following the change in government and financial assets (~$10bn) were frozen causing economic collapse. Afghanistan is also suffering from the worst drought for 27 years.

The withholding of foreign aid is a form of collective punishment on the people of Afghanistan. Starving an entire country and destroying its economy is not going to get rid of the Taliban.
attributes.background: The UK is one of the countries directly responsible for the state Afghanistan is currently in. Sign this petition to demand the UK government pay its part of the $4.4 billion the UN is requesting to help save Afghanistan and use its international position to encourage other countries to do the same.

rejection.details:
The UK is currently contributing to aid in Afghanistan

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-59518628

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to increase aid to Afghanistan, if that's what you'd like to see happen.
